perturbation.original_text: "LMG Tools" means the LMG-developed computer programs identified in  Exhibit A, including, where applicable object code (including microcode) and/or source code, that are provided or to be provided by LMG pursuant to this Agreement. The definition of LMG Tools also includes any enhancements, translations, modifications, updates, releases, or other changes to LMG Tools.
perturbation.changed_text: "LMG Tools" means the LMG-developed computer programs identified in  Exhibit A, including, where applicable object code (including microcode) and/or source code, that are provided or to be provided by LMG pursuant to this Agreement. The definition of LMG Tools *may* include any enhancements, translations, modifications, updates, releases, or other changes to LMG Tools at LMG's sole discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines LMG Tools as *including* any enhancements, translations, etc. The modified text changes this to *may* include, adding 'at LMG's sole discretion'. This introduces a contradiction, as it is now unclear whether LMG is obligated to provide updates or if it's optional.

perturbation.original_text: LMG grants TAG a worldwide, nonexclusive, irrevocable, perpetual license to load, execute, access, employ, use, store, or display ("Use") the object code version of the LMG Tools and Documentation (the "License") for the period specified in Exhibit A in accordance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: LMG grants TAG a worldwide, nonexclusive, *revocable*, perpetual license to load, execute, access, employ, use, store, or display ("Use") the object code version of the LMG Tools and Documentation (the "License") for the period specified in Exhibit A in accordance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text grants an 'irrevocable' license. The modified text changes this to 'revocable'. This is a direct contradiction, as the license cannot be both irrevocable and revocable. It creates uncertainty about TAG's long-term rights to use the LMG Tools.
perturbation.location: ARTICLE II LICENSE OF LMG TOOLS

perturbation.original_text: LMG shall provide (or will cause the third party vendor to provide) to TAG all error corrections and all operational and support assistance necessary to cause the LMG Tools, CSC Software and Other Third Party Software to perform in accordance with their Applicable Specifications. LMG shall also provide remedial support designed to provide a by-pass or temporary fix to a defect until the defect can be permanently corrected.
perturbation.changed_text: LMG shall provide (or will cause the third party vendor to provide) to TAG all error corrections and all operational and support assistance necessary to cause the LMG Tools, CSC Software and Other Third Party Software to perform in accordance with their Applicable Specifications. LMG *may* also provide remedial support designed to provide a by-pass or temporary fix to a defect until the defect can be permanently corrected.
perturbation.explanation: The original text 'LMG shall provide' remedial support, which dictates that LMG must perform. The modified text changes to 'LMG may also provide' remedial support. This change makes it at LMG's discretion, even if it is necessary to correct a permanent defect. This introduces contradiction.
perturbation.location: ARTICLE III SUPPORT AND HOSTING SERVICES
